title: National geographic logo
content:
hello,

Does anyone know the type used on the national geographic logo, I've already searched but I did not found anything.

Thank you
author: silviamfs

comments.content:
I believe it's a (probably customized) version of [Times New Roman Condensed](http://web.archive.org/web/20150407040855/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/times-new-roman/cond/) that's used as the magazine's flag.

David Thometz

Yes, I think the magazine still uses the Times New Roman Condensed version,  
but other applications (television, web) use the newer sans-serif logo.

David Thometz
